p: Throughout three religious frameworks discussed above, one main aspect becomes apparent: nature was created by God, or a higher power, and humankind stands at the centre. The potential implication of this shared belief is that willingness to adapt can go either way – whether a person adapts to climate change or cannot, will be influenced by the meaning they associate with humankind’s relationship to God’s creation. In fact, Hulme ( 2009:144) states that one of the reasons people disagree about climate change is that ‘[they] believe in different things about [their] duty to others, to Nature and to [their] deities’.
